summary: The document, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, provides a historical account of Manuel Machado, detailing his life as a Cuban revolutionary and CIA agent. It covers his involvement with the 26th of July group, his role as treasurer for the Mexican movement, and his initial friendship with Fidel Castro before his disillusionment with the Castro government. Additionally, the document outlines Machado's recruitment by the CIA for intelligence gathering on Cuban revolutionaries and his potential as a political action asset, along with his notable contacts and prestige within revolutionary circles.
key_findings: Manuel Machado was a Cuban revolutionary and CIA agent.
He was a member of the 26th of July group and treasurer for the Mexican movement.
Machado was a friend of Fidel Castro but became disillusioned with the Castro government.
He was recruited by the CIA to report on Cuban revolutionaries and possibly act as a political action asset.
The document highlights his contacts, including Ambassador Arcos y Bergnes, and his prestige in revolutionary circles.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
